title: Scene from A Different World - Evaluate source

content.description:
Step Scene at Hillman College, from the Television Series A Different World, 1987
NBC/Contributor/Getty Images
Hillman College was a fictional historically Black college that was the setting for A Different World from 1987 to 1993. Stepping is a performance style that blends African folk traditions with popular culture that was developed by African American fraternities and sororities in the mid-twentieth century.
content.question:
Respond to parts A, B, and C.

Describe one feature of the representations of African Americans on the stage or screen in the twentieth century.

Explain how a historical context could have influenced the representations of African Americans, such as depicted in the source.

Explain how depictions of African Americans in the performing arts could be useful sources for African American Studies scholars.
